approvalMetadata.approvalMethod: explicit human approval after gate review

goal: Build ClawForge v0 as a deterministic, audit-first platform that converts free-form ideas into fully specified plans and executes them only after strict human-approved gating.
nonGoals: Supporting opaque or heuristic-only AI decisions
Being a general-purpose low-code or no-code platform

interfaces.name: Idea Input
interfaces.description: Accepts free-form human ideas as unstructured text.

interfaces.name: Artifacts
interfaces.description: JSON artifacts for DoD, Decision Lock, Gate Result, and Execution Plan.

interfaces.name: CLI
interfaces.description: Human-operated interface for recording, approving, gating, and executing sessions.

invariants: Execution cannot occur unless evaluateExecutionGate().passed === true.
All execution actions must be enumerated before execution begins.
No kernel behavior is modified by session orchestration.
All verification must be reproducible post hoc.
constraints: No network calls during execution unless explicitly listed in the execution plan.
All artifacts must be schema-versioned and immutable once approved.
Human approval is mandatory and non-delegable.

failureModes.description: Vague DoD items allow ambiguous execution outcomes.
failureModes.mitigation: Reject vague language at schema validation and gate evaluation.

failureModes.description: AI introduces unplanned actions during execution.
failureModes.mitigation: Require full execution plan enumeration and disallow dynamic branching.

failureModes.description: Human bypass attempts via configuration or flags.
failureModes.mitigation: Permanent gate invariant enforced structurally and tested.

risksAndTradeoffs.description: Higher upfront planning cost may discourage casual use.
